subject: Productivity
title: Status Quo Bias
description: A quick win: understand Status Quo Bias.

hook.text: Most people never change their phone's default settings. The default wins by doing nothing.

buildup.text: Status quo bias means people prefer the current state of affairs, even when better options exist.

discovery.text: Organ donation rates soar in countries where the default is opt-in. The form design decides who lives.

twist.text: The bias isn't laziness. It's loss aversion in disguise â€” changing feels like losing the current option.

climax.text: Designing better defaults is one of the most powerful tools in behavioral economics.

punchline.text: The default option almost always wins.

quiz.question: Why do people tend to stick with the status quo?
options: Change feels like losing the current option
The current state is always the best
People carefully analyze all alternatives first
